intro: Gethyllis lata subsp. orbicularis, commonly known as the broad-leafed gethyllis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are orbicular, meaning they are round or nearly round in shape, which is a key distinguishing feature of this subspecies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or sandy habitats.
